instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> New batt and MB --> Slow
threads.message:
Hi, 

Any suggestions on a (terribly) slow <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? Both motherboard and battery have recently been replaced by Apple. 

Thanks, 

Rick

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> New batt and MB --> Slow
threads.message:
Return for a warranty repair?
Run ASD and check sensor errors.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> New batt and MB --> Slow
threads.message: Thanks. Warranty repair was rejected as the customer was too late (>3months). Will try ASD.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> New batt and MB --> Slow
threads.message: Fixed by replacing the HDD. Thanks for your suggestions.
